Directions

A first-order, gas-phase reaction (A → B) is carried out in an isothermal plug flow reactor (PFR) with recycle. The fresh feed concentration (CA,f = 0.200 mol/L) and fresh feed volumetric flow rate are known. Use sliders to change the recycle ratio (\(\frac{\text{recycle volumetric flow rate}}{\text{fresh feed volumetric flow rate}}\)) and the PFR volume. The correct reactant exit concentration (CA,e) is obtained iteratively by guessing the reactor inlet concentration (CA,0) with the slider, and then solving the PFR mass balance to determine CA,f. A mass balance around the mixing point before the PFR yields the calculated CA,0. Change the CA,0 value using the slider until the calculated CA,f (the black arrow on the left) equals 0.200 mol/L (the center of the green circle). The graph on the right plots the reactant concentration down the PFR using the guessed CA,0 value. For larger values of the recycle ratio, the PFR with recycle behaves like a continuous stirred-tank reactor (CSTR).
